an9.83:3.1: 83 Weaknesses in Training and the Bases of Psychic Power
an9.83:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five weaknesses when you’re training.
an9.83:4.3: Killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and using alcohol and drugs which cause negligence.
an9.83:4.5: These are the five weaknesses when you’re training.
an9.83:5.1: To give up these five weaknesses in your training you should develop the four bases of psychic power.
an9.83:5.3: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor. They develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy, and active endeavor.
an9.83:5.4: They develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to higher mind, and active endeavor.
an9.83:5.5: They develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to inquiry, and active endeavor.
an9.83:5.6: To give up those five weaknesses in your training you should develop these four bases of psychic power.”
